channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: “Lift & Learn” Fitness/Nutrition Session to be Held October 30
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 30, 2024 12:00 PM - 1:30 PM - In this fitness and nutrition program, led by our experienced strength and conditioning coach, participants will engage in guided workout sessions tailored to various fitness levels and learn about proper nutrition to support their fitness goals. Please register if you would like to attend!
item.author: Students

item.title: Second Game Jam to be Held October 25
item.description: RPI’s Game Dev Club is hosting its second Game Jam of the year starting on Friday, October 25 at 5pm in VAST (Sage 2411). Please join us once again (or for the first time!) for a 48-hour jam (with overnight breaks beginning at 10:00 PM both Friday and Saturday nights with doors opening again at 8:00 AM each morning). Teams will be formed to design their own game from scratch. Students of all years, areas of study, and experience levels are welcome to participate!
item.author: Students

item.title: EMPAC+ to Host Pizza Pre-Show for Rensselaer Students
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 23, 2024 6:00 PM - Rensselaer students are invited to connect with their friends at the free EMPAC+ pizza pre-show, then join the one-night-only film screening of “An Evening with Bassem Saad and Sanja Grozdanić,” in which the artists will discuss their “cinepoem” collaborations and then show a selection of films they’ve chosen to illuminate their EMPAC-commissioned performance, “Permanent Trespass.”
item.author: Students

item.title: Graduate “Lunch and Learn” Event to Highlight Personal Financial Management
item.description: Date: Wednesday, November 6, 2024 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM - During this session, Professor Johan Maharjan will present insight into personal financial management, discuss the core areas of managing personal finance, and offer strategies for budgeting, tackling debt, using credit cards, saving for retirement, and much more. Limited seating for this hybrid event will be available in the CBIS Bruggeman Room, or participants can attend via Webex. Lunch will be served from 11-11:30 AM.
item.author: Students

item.title: CRCC Internship Fair to be Held November 14
item.description: Still searching for a spring or summer internship? Planning to stay local? CRCC is hosting its 8th annual Internship Fair, which will be held from noon until 3:00PM on Thursday, November 14 and is open to RPI students of all majors. Employers will be hiring from various industries, so be sure to register in Handshake!
item.author: Students

item.title: UPDATE: President’s Fall Town Meeting Rescheduled for October 24
item.description: Date: Thursday, October 24, 2024 3:00 PM - 4:30 PM - President Martin A. Schmidt ’81, Ph.D., invites all members of the campus community to attend the Fall Town Meeting, which will be held in the Curtis R. Priem Experimental Media and Performing Arts Center (EMPAC) theater.
item.author: Community

item.title: RPI Concert to Highlight Partnership Between Major Experimental Composers
item.description: At 4:00PM on Wednesday, November 6 in the Concert Hall of the Curtis R. Priem Experimental Media and Performing Arts Center, faculty, students, and alumni from Rensselaer’s Arts Department will present Time Regained, a concert showcasing the partnership of Pauline Oliveros and Terry Riley through the lens of time-delay techniques.
item.author: Community

item.title: Order of the Engineer Induction Ceremony Scheduled for October 30
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 30, 2024 6:00 PM - 8:00 PM - Initiated in the United States to foster a spirit of pride and responsibility in the engineering profession, the Order of the Engineer will be inducting senior and graduate engineering students at this year’s ceremony, with initiates receiving a stainless steel ring to remind them to make ethical decisions throughout their engineering careers. Come and show your support for these new inductees!
item.author: Community

item.title: HR Posts 2024 New York State Election Information Regarding Time Off to Vote
item.description: With Election Day right around the corner, Rensselaer’s Division of Human Resources has some timely reminders for all faculty and staff who are registered to vote.
item.author: Community

item.title: “Be the Media” Workshop with Film Director Mark Decena Scheduled for October 25
item.description: Join HASS at 5pm on October 25 at The Sanctuary for Independent Media in North Troy for a “Be the Media” workshop and film screening with film director Mark Decena, Founder of Kontent Films and Director of “Farming While Black.” The film examines the historical plight of Black farmers in the United States, as well as the rising generation of Black farmers reclaiming their rightful ownership to land and reconnecting with their ancestral roots.
item.author: Community

item.title: Ramakrishnan to Speak at SCOREC Seminar
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 23, 2024 12:15 PM - 1:00 PM - This seminar will feature a presentation titled “Multi-Disciplinary Analysis and Optimization of Micro-Channel Evaporators” by speaker Vignesh Ramakrishnan in room 2C22 of the Jonsson Rowland Science Center. Pizza? Yes!
item.author: Community

item.title: “Reimagining History: The Artistic Vision and Storytelling of ‘I Dream’” Discussion Scheduled for October 23
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 23, 2024 1:00 PM - 2:30 PM - Douglas Tappin, author and composer of “I Dream,” will discuss his vision and storytelling in advance of its concert performance on November 1.
item.author: Community

item.title: Be a Part of Black Families Technology Awareness Day 2025!
item.description: Scheduled for Saturday, February 1, Black Families Technology Awareness Day 2025 is designed to excite and engage K-12 students and their parents or guardians in science, technology, engineering, the arts and mathematics! Program proposals are being sought for the event and submissions are due by November 1; campus community members are invited to register through December 5 to volunteer. Please see the BFTAD website for more information.
item.author: Community

item.title: Don’t Miss the Halloween “Paw-ty” on October 26!
item.description: Date: Saturday, October 26, 2024 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM - Join Presidential Pups Easton and Jojo in costume and celebration before the RPI Women’s Hockey Team takes on Harvard at 3:00PM! Attendees can show up in costume or just stop by the Houston Field House lobby from 2PM to 3PM for a visit and some free treats while supplies last. Note that no game ticket is required for the lobby meet-and-greet.
item.author: Community

item.title: “Tips for Planning Your Condensed Course” to be Topic of Fac/Staff Quick Learn Webinar
item.description:
Date: Monday, October 28, 2024 11:00 AM - 11:30 AM - Meant to assist instructors who are teaching in The Arch or short semester courses in planning and presenting their course material in innovative, effective, and carefully considered ways, this webinar will offer quick tips on best practices in condensing coursework. Please register if you plan to attend.
